text: everyone Thomas Joseph here with another
pantry hack for you one of my favorite
things to have in the pantry is sherry
vinegar today I'm gonna show you three
unique ways to use sherry vinegar and
I'm sure some of them are gonna shock
you a little bit so I'm gonna start off
with making a glaze that I'm gonna use
in two different dishes so I need 1/2 a
cup of sherry vinegar sherry vinegar is
produced in the sherry region of Spain
and it's been aged for at least six
months which gives it this nice rich
color and nuanced flavor it really is
unlike any other vinegar much less sweet
than balsamic vinegar as well so 1/2 a
cup into a small saucepan here and with
that 1/2 cup of light brown sugar so
this is basically a two ingredient plus
water glaze that's what we're making
here so I'm just gonna crumble up the
light brown sugar over medium heat I'm
gonna bring this to a boil and I'm going
to simmer it for about 4 minutes until
it's nice thick and syrupy so the syrup
is nice and thick and viscous I'm going
to thin it out with a teaspoon of water
this is just so that it doesn't harden
up too much I love to serve this on
grilled fish but you can certainly serve
it on anything
grilled chicken would be great this
would be wonderful on steak as well and
just a little bit of a glaze over a
salmon filet is really really delicious
it gives you that sweet-and-sour flavor
something a little bit different you can
take the syrup over a little bit of ice
cream and some strawberries you have the
most delicious and unique dessert for
another great way to use sherry vinegar
I like to use it whenever I'm roasting
vegetables whenever I'm grilling
vegetables and what that does that acid
it really helps to bring out all of the
flavors and it gives it gives the final
dish a little bit of a kick so I have
some grilled zucchini here a little bit
of sherry vinegar around the outside of
the bowl about 4 teaspoons for 3
zucchini and a hefty pinch of chilli
flakes
and that gives a nice kick of heat I'm
gonna gently toss this you don't want to
break up the zucchini because it is a
soft vegetable so gently stir it around
kind of fold it around the bowl that's
it so simple I'm gonna arrange this
nicely on a platter now you could do
this with yellow squash any summer
squash that you have I'm gonna drizzle
the rest of the vinegar in the chili
mixture right over the top a little bit
extra salt and to finish it off one of
my favorite things to kind of brighten
up the flavors a little bit of mint so
you have that nice tangy sourness from
the vinegar and you have that wonderful
minty flavor and there you go a really
simple and delicious side dish for the
summer or any time of year for that
matter so I hope I've inspired you to
take the sherry vinegar out of your
pantry and use it in some really
interesting ways a splash is really all
you need and if you have any kitchen
hacks that you need solve do have
something in your pantry something in
your freezer well if you do write in the
comment section below or use the hashtag
kitchen conundrums and I will answer
whatever question you pose
you
